name: Application
description: Represents an application. Any application that outsources authentication to Azure AD must be registered in a directory. This involves telling Azure AD about your application, including the URL where it's located, the URL to send replies after authentication, the URI to identify your application, and more.  For more information, see [Basics of Registering an Application in Azure AD](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/active-directory-authentication-scenarios/#basics-of-registering-an-application-in-azure-ad). Inherits from [DirectoryObject].

properties.name: appId
properties.description: The unique identifier for the application.

properties.name: appRoles
properties.description: The collection of application roles that an application may declare. These roles can be assigned to users, groups or service principals.                              **Notes**: Requires version 1.5, not nullable.

properties.name: availableToOtherTenants
properties.description: **true** if the application is shared with other tenants; otherwise, **false**.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: The display name for the application.

properties.name: groupMembershipClaims
properties.description: A bitmask that configures the "groups" claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the application expects. The bitmask values are: 0: None, 1: Security groups and Azure AD roles, 2: Reserved, and 4: Reserved. Setting the bitmask to 7 will get all of the security groups, distribution groups, and Azure AD directory roles that the signed-in user is a member of.                              **Notes**: Requires version 1.5.

properties.name: homepage
properties.description: The URL to the applicationâ€™s homepage.

properties.name: identifierUris
properties.description: The URIs that identify the application. For more information see, [Application Objects and Service Principal Objects](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/active-directory-application-objects/).                              **Notes:** not nullable, the **any** operator is required for filter expressions on multi-valued properties; for more information, see [Supported Queries, Filters, and Paging Options](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn727074.aspx).

properties.name: keyCredentials
properties.description: The collection of key credentials associated with the application                              **Notes:** not nullable

properties.name: knownClientApplications
properties.description: Client applications that are tied to this resource application. Consent to any of the known client applications will result in implicit consent to the resource application through a combined consent dialog (showing the OAuth permission scopes required by the client and the resource).                              **Notes**: Requires version 1.5, not nullable.

properties.name: mainLogo
properties.description: The main logo for the application.                              **Notes:** not nullable

properties.name: oauth2AllowImplicitFlow
properties.description: Specifies whether this web application can request OAuth2.0 implicit flow tokens. The default is **false**.                              **Notes**: Requires version 1.5, not nullable.

properties.name: oauth2AllowUrlPathMatching
properties.description: Specifies whether, as part of OAuth 2.0 token requests, Azure AD will allow path matching of the redirect URI against the application's **replyUrls**. The default is **false**.                              **Notes**: Requires version 1.5, not nullable.

properties.name: oauth2Permissions
properties.description: The collection of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that the web API (resource) application exposes to client applications. These permission scopes may be granted to client applications during consent.                              **Notes**: Requires version 1.5, not nullable.

properties.name: passwordCredentials
properties.description: The collection of password credentials associated with the application.                              **Notes:** not nullable

properties.name: publicClient
properties.description: Specifies whether this application is a public client (such as an installed application running on a mobile device).  Default is **false**.

properties.name: replyUrls
properties.description: Specifies the URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to.                              **Notes:** not nullable

properties.name: requiredResourceAccess
properties.description: Specifies resources that this application requires access to and the set of OAuth permission scopes and application roles that it needs under each of those resources. This pre-configuration of required resource access drives the consent experience.                              **Notes**: Requires version 1.5, not nullable.

properties.name: samlMetadataUrl
properties.description: The URL to the SAML metadata for the application.

properties.name: objectType
properties.description: A string that identifies the object type. For applications the value is always "Application". Inherited from [DirectoryObject].

properties.name: objectId
properties.description: The unique identifier for the application. Inherited from [DirectoryObject].                              **Notes: **                **key**, immutable, not nullable, unique

properties.name: extensionProperties
properties.description: The extension properties associated with the application. Requires 1.5 or newer.

properties.name: owners
properties.description: Directory objects that are owners of the application. The owners are a set of non-admin users who are allowed to modify this object. Requires version 2013-11-08 or newer. Inherited from [DirectoryObject].
